Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in rejecting the applicant's claim based on credibility findings and state protection analysis
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed refugee status due to fear of persecution from an abusive former partner in Namibia
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's negative decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by an abusive former partner in Namibia
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of testimony, adequacy of state protection in Namibia
Credibility_Assessment: Board found inconsistencies in the applicant's testimony regarding police interactions
Application_Basis: Claim of fear of persecution due to domestic abuse
Evidence_Assessed: Inconsistencies in testimony, country reports on Namibia
Relief_Sought: Overturn of Board's rejection of refugee claim
Governing_Rule: Credibility findings and state protection assessments are reviewed for reasonableness
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Inconsistencies in applicant's account of police interactions
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from abusive former partner in Namibia
Cause_Description: Applicant feared persecution from an abusive former partner and claimed inadequate state protection in Namibia
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed credibility and weighed country condition evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Testimony found inconsistent; country evidence showed adequate state protection
Decision_Rationale: Board's decision was reasonable and supported by evidence
